content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the Julia code blocks from a markdown document and removes code fences:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    code_blocks = String[]
    in_code_block = false
    code_fence_start = "```julia\n"
    code_fence_end = "\n```"

    for (i, char) in enumerate(md)
        if char == '`'
            if md[i-2:i] == code_fence_start
                in_code_block = true
            elseif md[i:i+2] == code_fence_end
                push!(code_blocks, md[i+3:prevind(md, i)-1])
                in_code_block = false
            end
        end
    end

    return join(code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```

This function iterates through the given markdown string, detects Julia code fences, and appends the code blocks to an array. After processing all code blocks, it joins them together with a double newline and returns the resulting string.
